item.description:
The Guns of Amoskeag

An illustrated lecture by Ray Cresswell

Saturday, March 17, 2012

10:30 a.m. - at the Millyard Museum

$10 general public - FREE to Manchester Historic Association members

Pre-registration is requested by calling (603) 622-7531

 

This illustrated talk will explore the history of gun production at the Amoskeag Manufacturing Company. Ray Cresswell is an expert on this topic, and a long time member, supporter and volunteer of the Manchester Historic Association. He will set the scene with a short history of the AMC, and will explain the influence of the company's brilliant and innovative local manager, Ezekiel Straw. Ray will then talk about the AMC's production of rifle muskets during the CIvil War, and about inventor Edward Lindner and his Civil War carbines. On display will be the speaker's AMC rifle musket, an AMC shotgun, three Lindner carbines and a rare Lindner shotgun. The audience may also view the museum's display of an AMC rifle musket, a percussion shotgun, molds and other materials related to gun-making at the AMC.

 

Photo:  Detail of an Amoskeag Rifle Musket
